                "The term in square brackets, which can be any constant integer expression, specifies which element of the array is to be initialized by the value of the term after the "
              ],
              ["=", [["c"]]],
              [
                " sign. Unspecified elements are default initialized, which means zeros are defined. The example shows the designated initializers in order; they do not have to be in order. The example shows gaps; those are legitimate. The example doesnâ€™t show two different initializations for the same element; that too is allowed (ISO/IEC 9899:2011, Â§6.7.9 Initialization, Â¶19 "

                "The initialization shall occur in initializer list order, each initializer provided for a particular subobject overriding any previously listed initializer for the same subobject",

                "struct discriminated_union\n{\n    enum { DU_INT, DU_DOUBLE } discriminant;\n    union\n    {\n        int     du_int;\n        double  du_double;\n    };\n};\n\nstruct discriminated_union du1 = { .discriminant = DU_INT, .du_int = 1 };\nstruct discriminated_union du2 = { .discriminant = DU_DOUBLE, .du_double = 3.14159 };"

            ]
